title: Application Developer Lead (Remote)
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**



The Application Developer Lead is the primary point of contact on implementation projects for all internal DC project team and is recognized by the project team as the expert on the product and project. Serves as the point of escalation for project related activities. They are responsible for the performance of the team and is expected to mentor team members by increasing their knowledge and skills of the project, product and customer. Also, may be expected to work across multiple complex projects simultaneously.

  


**PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Oversees development team to ensure the configuration and custom components meet application requirements and performance goals.
* Oversees the configuration, building, and testing of the application.
* Ensure debugging and remediation of application system errors are being handled promptly and efficiently.
* Leads discussions with Business Stakeholders to understand and translate technical requirements into user and application requirements.
* Leads development team and delivers successful outcomes, while anticipating business challenges and implementing solutions.
* Serve as primary point of escalation for project team and customer, engaging leadership only when necessary, articulating issues, calling out risks on developing efforts.
* Provide summary project status reporting visibility for all internal DC project implementations to CFP IT leadership.
* Serves as a mentor for development team.
* Performs other related duties and activities as required.

  



**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**


* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a closely-related Computer/IT technical and analytics field
* Minimum of 12 years’ professional experience, preferably in implementing software applications
* Experience with Duck Creek configuration and systems integration (Policy, Billing, Claims, Reinsurance, third-party systems).
* Experience with implementation of Duck Creek Platform
* Experience in implementing P&C Insurance software applications
* Experience in HTML, ASP, and XML preferred
* Previous experience working in a customer facing role
* Demonstrated experience leading a team and managing employee performance
* Facilitation experience for conducting requirements gathering and stakeholder agreement meetings
* Familiar with business process design concepts and principles.
* Familiarity with insurance products, rules and methodologies desirable
* Familiarity with merge fields for Microsoft Word and Adobe
* Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

title: Lead Analyst, Supply Chain Systems - Remote
description:
**Logistics at full potential.**

  

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

  

Are you ready to take your career to the next level with a rapidly growing global company? As the Lead Analyst, Supply Chain Systems, you will support the information systems component for the Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), perform service management processes, foster and maintain ongoing client relationships and configure systems. You’ll also write specifications for new development and system enhancements, as well as perform and coordinate quality assurance testing under the direction of senior analysts and managers. If you’re looking for an exciting opportunity with a dynamic company, join us at GXO.

 **Pay, benefits and more.**


We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

 **What you’ll do on a typical day:**

* Participate in the business development process to analyze client requirements, determine fit and customizations
* Create proposals, gather supporting data for cost estimates and present GXO’s capabilities and solutions to prospective clients
* Support project manager during system implementations/upgrades and provide continuing support
* Develop documented implementation plans, configure systems, train users and provide post-implementation support
* Create detailed functional specifications for modifications, defect corrections, enhancements and user documentation
* Perform process and data modeling; perform integrated quality assurance testing on system changes before they are released to key users
* Work creatively with end users to perform user acceptance testing on system changes before they are released to the field
* Deliver training to power users on system use; provide system configuration site support to distribution centers and operations center
* Provide support to resolve data-related problems with logistics information systems

**What you need to succeed at GXO:**


At a minimum, you’ll need:

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or a related technical field, or equivalent related work or military experience
* 4 years of experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) development and implementation
* Implementation and support experience with web-based applications, WMS, Transportation Management Systems (TMS) and small parcel shipment systems
* Expertise and experience in at least one of the following business disciplines: supply chain management, warehousing, transportation or distribution
* Experience using SQL for data analysis, extraction, troubleshooting and reporting
* Thorough understanding of current information systems technologies such as client/server, relational databases, web-based systems, and object-oriented design


It’d be great if you also have:

* Master’s degree
* Oracle SQL programming experience
* 5 years of experience with WMS development and implementation
* Knowledge of formal systems development methodologies

**We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.**

  

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

  

GXO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with GXO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.

  

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

title: Segment Manager - Food & Beverage
description:
Description:

AAF International offers the most comprehensive clean air solutions available across the globe. Selling under the American Air Filter® and the AAF International® brand names, AAF International has been an industry pioneer since 1921 with manufacturing operations in 22 countries and over 6000 employees globally. Our products are the industry benchmarks for quality and performance. Our applications include commercial, industrial and residential solutions from the filters used in your home to the most critical cleanroom and power generation applications.


We are a member of the Daikin Group, the world's largest air conditioning provider with $30 billion in revenue and over 75,000 employees worldwide. Founded in 1924, Daikin has grown into a diversified industrial manufacturing company offering solutions in clean, air, air conditioning, refrigeration, chemicals, oil hydraulics, defense systems and electronics.


Our culture of continuous improvement, safety and world class operations is driven by our people-centered management philosophy. This philosophy is built around mutual selection: that while AAF seeks top talent people to join and deliver on our team, we also want each team member to receive job satisfaction, growth & development, and continued happiness in being a long-term member of the AAF family. This is fueled by our belief in treating our people, our supply partners, our customers and our environment with the trust and respect we each require, and our passion to give back to our community for our success.


Read more about our philosophy at: http://www.daikin.com/about/corporate/philosophy/index.html


AAF International is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran.

**We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, uniform servicemember status, age, disability or any other legally recognized protected personal characteristics.**

**Position Objective:**


The Segment Manager - Food & Beverage plans, directs, controls, and coordinates the sales of the company’s products within the Food and Beverage customer segment and the field sales force, working directly with F&B manufacturers to implement AAF’s value added products and services. The role ensures products are sold in accordance with budgeted objectives to obtain maximum profitability and sales volume in relation to established marketing and sales standards while continually evaluating the timely adjustment of the company’s marketing strategy and sales plans to meet changing marketing and sales conditions.

**Key Accountabilities:**

* Formulate and recommend policies and objectives for the organization’s sales activities to ensure achievement of business sales and profitability objectives.
* Coordinate activities of the marketing operation in accomplishing organization objectives and sales goals.
* Direct sales planning which includes an analysis of competitive products and selling techniques, market share, quotas, pricing, and distribution.
* Formulate and recommend policies and objectives to ensure the most effective operation of direct field sales activities. Ensure that approved policies and objectives are fully understood by all assigned personnel.
* Recommend product modifications or improvements based on findings of marketing research, technical service work, or sales personnel feedback.
* Recommend pricing policies including quantities, terms and conditions of sales.
* Recommend delegation of pricing authority and individual pricing questions with policy implications.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


Requirements:
**Position Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited University in Business, Engineering or a related field;
* 10-15 years of relevant selling experience;
* Understanding and experience with high value added product selling, pricing, negotiating and channel management;
* Ability to communicate and sell both products and value concepts at all organizational levels;
* Be able to synthesize various input and ideas into relevant and clear strategies and secure buy-in from diverse teams in order to implement them;
* Must understand the importance and role of “brand” in building a profitable business, and have experience in product management. P&L management capability a requirement. A history of consistently delivering on expectations for growth and profitability must be demonstrated;
* **Team player with proven success in building strong national and remote sales teams;**
* **This position can be located near any major airport.**

title: Lead, Quality Assurance-Remote
description:
**Lumicera Health Services Powered by Navitus**

**Innovative Specialty Pharmacy Solutions-** *Lumicera Health Services is defining the “new norm” in specialty pharmacy to optimize patient well-being* through our core principles of transparency and stewardship. Here at Lumicera, our team members work in an environment that celebrates creativity and fosters diversity.


Due to growth, we are adding this Lead, Quality Assurance to our IT Department


We are unable to offer remote work to residents of Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Dakota, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming.


The QA Lead will play a crucial role in the successful implementation of several software projects and help develop a QA strategy applicable to all users/applications. Reporting to the Director of I.T, this individual will lead a team of QAs and function as a player/coach to drive the QA strategy for Lumicera.


The QA Lead is a pivotal role in our large- scale IT modernization project, focusing on the effective planning, coordination, and execution of comprehensive testing strategies. This position demands a highly skilled individual with exceptional experience in Azure DevOps, AWS or other cloud platforms and a proven track record in developing advanced testing frameworks using modernized tools.


Is this you? Find out more below!

**How do I make an impact on my team?**

* Develop and implement a robust testing strategy encompassing all aspects of the modernization project.
* Participate in teams to develop comprehensive test strategies, plans, impact analysis, specifications, and test cases for effective assurance and testing functions.
* Author test cases/scripts and execution plans for both project and support-related activities.
* Design and implement automated test plans to streamline testing processes.
* Provide oversight to ensure automation test suites are well-maintained and operational.
* Utilize tools like Azure DevOps for test automation, ensuring alignment with project objectives and timelines.
* Plan and execute performance and stress tests to evaluate system stability and scalability.
* Analyze test results and provide insights for system enhancements and optimizations.
* Provide accurate estimates for QA efforts including test case design/scripting, test execution, and defect correction.
* Identify opportunities to improve application code quality by increasing unit and integration test coverage.
* Contribute to and define best practices, processes, scorecards, KPIs, and tools for the QA organization ensuring overall productivity and quality is always measured and improved in line with targeted milestones

**What our team expects from you?**

* Bachelors in computer science, Information Systems, or related technical discipline or equivalent Information Technology experience.
* Experience in Microsoft Azure Dev Ops
* Experience and knowledge of Test Management principles, methodologies, and tools.
* Familiarity with project mgmt. approaches, tools, and phases of the project lifecycle.
* Experience with large-scale modernization project.
* 4+ years of experience in Leading QA teams
* 5+ years of experience developing and executing SOA / API automated test scripts using modern QA Frameworks
* 5+ years of experience working with automated test frameworks and CICD Integration using GitHub.
* 5+ years of experience with test case management and test case management tools
* 5+ years of experience utilizing risk-based testing techniques.
* 5+ years of experience with defect management and using defect management tools like JIRA.
* 5+ years of experience managing test environments.
* 5+ years of experience with defect management and using defect management tools like JIRA.
* 5+ years of experience managing test environments
* Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives
* The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees

**What can you expect from Lumicera?**

* Hours/Location: Monday - Friday 8:00am-5:00pm, CST-Remote
* Paid Volunteer Hours
* Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance
* Referral Bonus Program – up to $750!
* Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Nine paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program

**#LI-Remote**

title: Capture Manager (Director/VP Level)
description:
**BDR Solutions, LLC, (BDR)** supports the U.S. Federal Government in successfully achieving its mission and goals. Our service and solution delivery starts with understanding each client's end-state, and then seamlessly integrating within each Agency's organization to improve and enhance business and technical operations and deployments.  

**BDR** is seeking a **Capture Manager (Director or VP Level)** to join our growing team! This position will be performed virtually from the individual's home office working on EST time schedule. **This position requires US Citizenship with a Public Trust or the ability to obtain one.**  

  

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*  

  

**Role Overview:**  

  

The Capture Manager will be responsible for securing and winning existing and new business opportunities within the Federal marketspace. Capture Manager will develop (in collaboration with technical SMEs) technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, cyber security, management consulting, and program management to support the development of high-quality technical solutions for technical proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have a successful track record winning work within the Federal IT marketspace, with prior experience serving as Program/Project Manager, Business Development Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, or Capture Manager.  

  

**Responsibilities:*** Lead, manage, and mature business opportunities from qualification, planning, bid, award, and support early transition of programs/projects.
* Ability to identify internal and external (teaming partners / subcontractors) and successfully negotiate non-disclosure agreements and teaming agreements.
* Ability to define the path to winning opportunities.
* Develop and refine value propositions and win themes based on customer interactions, competitive intelligence, and core competencies.
* Develop competitive intelligence to drive proposal win themes /critical success factors.
* Experience with developing level of efforts that result in price-to-win strategies.
* Apply analytics, problem-solving and communication skills to identify best fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposal to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.
* Support the validation of innovative and cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.
* Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients
* Collect, dissect, and process policies, strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies for future IT requirements
* Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.
* Support the development and writing of technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings
* Lead management aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meeting, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.
* Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.
* Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.
* Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development

  

**Required Minimum Qualifications:*** Bachelor's degree in information technology, Information Systems, or other related discipline ( 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education)
* Demonstrate a minimum of 5+ years with experience in proposal development and/or capture management
* In depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High-level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication

  

**Desired Skills and Qualifications:*** Experience in developing and maintaining effective internal and external business relationships with clients and industry partners
* Experience with successfully leading captures for small or large business opportunities
* Proven experience working in high pace environments with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, and STARS III
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating orally and in writing, and producing high-quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers


In addition, **U.S. citizenship** is required. Select applicants will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and be able to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.  

  

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.  

  

  

**About BDR Solutions:**  

  

BDR Solutions delivers IT expertise and solutions that improve American lives through the modernization of government systems for health benefits, social services, and disaster relief. We are a service-disabled veteran-owned, 8(a), HUBZone small business—recognized for reliable and sustainable outcomes scaled to our client’s mission needs.

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**Description**  

  

Position at Imagine Learning  

  

Great Purpose. Great People. Great Opportunities.  

  

At Imagine Learning we ignite learning breakthroughs. It drives everything we do. W e innovate together to support educators in creating those special moments when students experience the joy of learning at its best.  

  

We also ignite career breakthroughs, with the majority of our positions being fully remote opportunities that offer you what you're really looking for : flexible work arrangements, interesting and meaningful job responsibilities, career growth, and a supportive team .  

  

Imagine Your Impact .  

  

The Technical Product Manager is responsible for keeping customer focus, driving a vision, and evolving the company's platform and tools to meet the needs of our customers by delivering business value now and in the future to both customers and internal staff. Technical Product Managers have a focus on the underlying technology needed to deliver solutions to our K-12 customers and have a deep understanding of that architecture and technology.  

* Position Type : This is a regular, full-time position .
* Compensation : Base pay is anticipated to be between $ 93,268 and $ 135,000 per year. Eligible employees may also receive incentive/commission/annual bonus pay based on individual and/or company performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as, but not limited to, individual skills, experience, training, education/certifications, geographic location, internal equity, and local market conditions.
* Location : In this US-based position your location will be remote . **Must reside in the Eastern time zone.**
* Travel : You can also expect up to 10 % travel, so be sure you have a valid driver's license and automobile insurance and a clean driving record for at least the preceding 39 months.

  

Envision Your Experience .  

  

In this role you'll have the opportunity to:
* Drive the vision and execution of technical components of our platform, our tools, and our products in partnership with the rest of the Product Management team and other departments.
* Identify and communicate the business value of team efforts to stakeholders throughout the company.
* Communicate with key team members to understand the implications of decisions about complexity, depth, and timelines.
* Drive technically responsible enhancements to the company's platform and tools to support our product suite and both internal and external customers.
* Understand user needs and work with all necessary departments to bring products and tools to life.
* Demonstrate technical leadership by quickly gaining the trust of the development team; make tough decisions including, prioritizing bugs and "technical debt."
* Understand how our products are built and assess risks to articulate accurate estimates for duration of tasks.
* Leverage technical skills to close the communication gap between engineering and other departments, including Sales, Marketing, and the customer.
* Travel for some team meetings & conferences.
* Other duties as required .

  

Share Your Expertise .  

  

Experience, education, and qualifications essential for success in this role, include:
* Bachelor's degree in computer science , Information Systems, or a related field, and 3+ years of software product build experience as either an Associate Technical Product Manager, Business Analyst or Technical Project Manager; or an acceptable combination of education and experience.
* Experience working with and/or creating complex platform level technical architecture and requirements.
* Skilled at communicating with stakeholders.
* Deep understanding of complex software architecture and technology.
* Vast experience speaking and understanding complex technical requirements and language.
* Strong problem solving and communication skills.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams that include engineering, sales, and marketing.

  

Ignite Your Career .  

  

Imagine Learning is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We support your unique career journey by providing flexibility, investing in wellbeing, and propelling growth.  

  

We offer a flexible w orkplace , with the majority of employees enjoying the opportunity to work from home within the US . Headquartered in Scottsdale, AZ, we also maintain offices in Austin , TX, Petaluma , CA, and Rock Rapids , IA .  

  

Imagine Learning provides a comprehensive benefits program to eligible employees , including:
* M ultiple health, dental, and vision plans, including medical plans with zero employee premiums
* 401k plan with a company match
* C ompany-paid behavioral health coaching
* 1 5 paid holidays, including 2 floating holidays and a winter shutdown from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day
* 15 days of accrued annual Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Fertility benefits
* Paid bonding leave when a new child joins your family
* Life and short and long-term disability insurance
* Pre-tax savings plans
* P aid volunteer hours and annual giving events
* A wide variety of professional development programs , including tuition reimbursement

  

Imagine Learning is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status , or any other protected status . Imagine Learning will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals as required by law.

title: Technical Team Lead
description:
Join our remote team at **Inscyth Technologies** as a dynamic **Technical Team Lead**. At the forefront of driving innovation and delivering cutting-edge solutions, you lead a team of highly skilled individuals, nurturing their technical growth and success. From the comfort of your own home, you contribute to our success!


Now, here's the exciting part – enjoy a **competitive salary** that recognizes your expertise and dedication. You also benefit from a **10% bonus opportunity, a 401K with a 50% match (up to 5%), paid time off, 9 paid holidays, and provided computer equipment**.


Apply now to take the first step toward an exciting career with Inscyth Technologies.

 **WHAT WE'RE ALL ABOUT**


Our purpose is to create innovative technological solutions to help our client's businesses become more efficient and robust for their customers. We offer a variety of services, including consulting, software development, web design and development, and testing. Caring for our customers is what drives us to deliver a quality product, on time, every time.


Our enthusiasm for technology helps us gather a top-notch team who is excited to create and build enterprise-level solutions. We value the talent that each member of our team brings to the table. That is why we foster a supportive work environment that encourages each team member to achieve their goals and grow within our company. We love seeing our employees thrive! And, we are always looking for talented and driven individuals to join our work family.

 **WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN A TECHNICAL TEAM LEAD**

* Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, or equivalent
* 3+ years of management experience overseeing development teams, with a focus on managing developers
* Proficiency in at least one programming language
* Familiarity with React and JavaScript for application development
* Familiarity with Code Pipeline and its processes
* Strong coding background with the ability to provide hands-on support and guidance to the development team
* Experience with AWS is essential


Preferred Qualifications:

* Understanding of AWS/Azure offerings and capabilities
* AWS certification
* Previous work experience with Jira
* Knowledge and experience with .NET (C#)
* Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and deployment tools like Octopus

 **DAY-TO-DAY**


As the remote Technical Team Lead, your main tasks involve analyzing developer time in Jira tickets, ensuring a 15-20% margin when compared to TSheets records. You also verify time accuracy in commit logs and address discrepancies with developers, creating performance improvement plans if needed. Your days are spent managing schedules and ensuring developer availability during agreed-upon times. Additionally, you establish a standardized process for reporting time off and collaborate with HR in recruitment. You excel at conducting regular performance reviews where you provide feedback and recommendations for improvement. Working closely with the development team, you identify and eliminate inefficiencies, enhance performance, and maintain code quality. Strong leadership, effective communication, and collaboration with team members are essential.


If you think this management job is a fit for what you are looking for, great! Simply fill out our initial **3-minute application**.

title: Claims Processing and Management Services Project Manager
description:
**Req ID:** 273266


NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.


We are currently seeking a Claims Processing and Management Services Project Manager to join our team in Montgomery, Alabama (US-AL), United States (US).


Working in collaboration with project leadership, she/he will actively participate in project management activities as well as the delivery of tasks/activities and deliverables associated with the CPMS effort. Ensure state staff and system vendors share a common understanding of program, technical and business requirements as well as desired outcomes. Serve as subject matter expert and consulting resource for the organization. Collaborate internally and with state/customer staff to communicate business rules and technical changes to external stakeholders. In collaboration with other NTT DATA GCA consultants, the selected candidate will work directly with state staff and vendors to support the analysis, planning, design, implementation and evaluation of key system changes and processes to help the client achieve organizational goals.
  

Job Responsibilities Include:
  

• Experience monitoring procurement, DDI and day-to-day operations of an MMIS module and software/ system maintenance and changes. • Ability to identify, articulate and fully document risks and issues.
  

* Expert level knowledge in creating, managing, and maintaining project schedules.
* Must be forward-thinking while managing the project.
* Analytical skills required to review operations reports to detect inconsistencies or errors and to ensure SLAs, KPIs and metrics are being met.
* Excellent verbal and written communications and presentation skills

Basic Qualifications:
  

* Minimum 8+ years of experience managing multiple concurrent projects.
* Minimum 6+ years of experience managing implementation and operations of Medicaid or Major Health Care Payer projects.
* Minimum 6+ years of experience managing multi-contractor projects, or similar complex integration efforts.
* Minimum 4+ years of experience managing Claims Processing and Management Services projects.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business, or a related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Project Management Institute (PMI) Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification
Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this remote role is $84,000 - 140,000. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. Actual compensation will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate’s actual work location, relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.
  

This position is eligible for company benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance with an employer contribution, flexible spending or health savings account, life and AD&D insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program with company match, and additional voluntary or legally-required benefits.


**About NTT DATA Services**

NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services, including cloud, data and applications, headquartered in Texas. As part of NTT DATA, a $30 billion trusted global innovator with a combined global reach of over 80 countries, we help clients transform through business and technology consulting, industry and digital solutions, applications development and management, managed edge-to-cloud infrastructure services, BPO, systems integration and global data centers. We are committed to our clients’ long-term success. Visit nttdata.com or LinkedIn to learn more.


***NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.***

title: Product Manager - Cybersecurity
description:
**About Arctiq:**



Arctiq is a services-led firm providing expertise in the new world of IT transformation. We help clients build continuous improvement strategies using automation, orchestration, DevOps methodologies, security, cloud migration and optimization, and customized workflows. Arctiq helps development teams focus on development efforts and not infrastructure. Efficiencies are achieved through microservices and container-based solutions, self-service enablement, and repeatable deployment methodologies. Arctiq’s solutions help reduce risk and simplify tasks through standardized frameworks, workflow automation, and foundational IT practices.

 **Job Summary:**


**Product Manager - Cybersecurity**

Arctiq, now part of DynTek and rSolutions, prominent providers of professional IT services, cybersecurity, and risk management solutions across North America, is in the midst of expanding. We are actively seeking **a Product Manager - Cybersecurity.** If you're an ambitious, sharp-minded professional eager to advance your career in a challenging role, this opportunity might be the perfect fit for you!

  




The Product Manager - Cybersecurity is responsible for the successful delivery of complex technology-enabled projects and services to Mid-Market and Enterprise customers. The Product Manager - Cybersecurity will work with clients throughout the solution lifecycle to plan, design and deploy technology solutions that meet aggressive delivery schedules, complex technical specifications, and high-level requirements.  



  

  

Arctiq is currently seeking a candidate to fulfill a role as a Cybersecurity Product Manager. This position requires previous experience in related IT or IT security Product Management and a passion for continuous learning. The candidate will have the skills and expertise to identify customer needs, drive innovation, and shape the direction of our Cybersecurity services and solutions.

  




This role calls for someone with a deep knowledge of the IT, security, platforms and services. Independent direction, consensus building, and people management skills are all a must for this role. Strategically crafting long and short-term roadmaps that are in support of our company objectives are key aspects of the job. This Product Manager position requires a leader that can operate independently with still striving towards our vision, mission and values through ensuring we deliver top quality cybersecurity products and services for our clients. Travel will be required.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Define cyber security requirements for our products and services.
* Package and expand on Managed Services around cyber security solutions portfolio.


* Work closely with MSSP delivery team and related stakeholders
* Understand how all our security products work


* Perform market research and conduct competitive analysis
* Look through both technical and business lens


* Work closely on the business model with the sales and marketing teams
* Make sure these capabilities are documented and communicated clearly to everyone involved in the development process.


* Work closely with account executives to champion the services and solutions


* Collaborate with Product Marketing and Sales on driving adoption through pricing optimizations, blogs, webinars, and TCO analysis


* Engage with MSSP vendor partners to drive the future roadmap, pricing and execution


* Partner with Finance, Leadership, and HR to build budgets that align with multi-year expectations


* Skilled at communicating up, across, and down the organization


* Contribute to customer wallet share increases of services and managed services growth of the enterprise

  

  

**Qualifications:**


* 5 or more years’ experience with Product Management in the enterprise security space and go to market motions


* Have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, data processing or have demonstration of equivalent experience.


* Proven track record of strong management experience with strength in working cross functionally and with senior leadership and peers.

  


**Preferred Skills/Experience:**

  

* Strong critical thinking and technical diagnostic abilities.
* A solid foundational understanding of networking principals, security best practices and systems administration is required.


* Ability to work in project teams and complete individual tasks in a timely manner.


 Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* A sense of personal accountability.


* Ability to work with customers for problem solving and feature enhancement requests.
* Contribute to customer wallet share increases of services.

  

This position will work with both Canada and North America.

  

Arctiq is an equal opportunity employer. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know. We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives to apply.  



  

*We thank you for your interest in joining the Arctiq team! While we welcome all applicants, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.*

title: Governance, Risk, and Compliance Manager
description:
Meet MacStadium. We build cloud solutions to simplify Mac for business. We actively participate in and influence the Apple ecosystem in a cool way and have been a part of it since day one. Developers and end users at leading tech companies, big enterprises, and small teams rely on MacStadium’s innovative solutions every day. We have a passionate team of hard working, hard playing professionals with a big, shared vision. Come join us as we grow again!  

  

**What we need:**  

We are seeking an experienced Governance, Risk and Compliance Manager responsible for coordinating, reviewing, and implementing policies to maintain an efficient Governance, Risk, and Compliance program. A successful candidate will effectively communicate various types of risks, audit the effectiveness of controls, identify potential threats, and develop plans/controls to mitigate problems. This position will require high ethical standards in performing their duties and must align and support the company’s objectives.  

  

This position reports to the Director - Information Security and preferred location for this role is in Atlanta, GA.  

  

MacStadium's current U.S. office locations are in Atlanta, GA and Las Vegas, NV. While it is ideal to have this position located in close proximity to one of our offices, we are open to filling the role remotely outside of the states of Georgia and Nevada (within the United States) for the right candidate.  

  

**What you will be doing:*** Lead MacStadium’s operational and strategic information security GRC efforts as defined by the GRC Service Catalog
* Develop and guide implementation of control systems to support legal requirements, internal policies, and other relevant stakeholder interests
* Conduct periodic internal reviews and/or audits against identified compliance targets Serve as lead contact for MacStadium’s internal and/or external compliance audit(s) efforts
* Assess product, compliance, or operational risks and develop risk management strategies
* Identify compliance issues and conduct or direct internal compliance investigations
* Verify that systems/solutions are in place to adequately provide oversight and continuous monitoring in all required areas
* Monitor compliance systems to ensure their effectiveness
* Identify and communicate with management regarding emerging compliance requirements
* Advise internal management or business partners on the implementation or operation of compliance programs
* Serve as a confidential point of contact for employees to communicate with management, seek clarification on issues or dilemmas, and report irregularities related to Governance, Risk and Compliance
* Manage employee security awareness training efforts
* Prepare management reports regarding compliance operations from both a business unit and corporate perspective
* Manage and fulfill vendor risk analyses in a timely manner
* Manage content shared in the MacStadium Trust Center and related customer security inquiry processes
* Manage customer security questionnaire response library

  

**What Skills and Experience you need to have:*** Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Security, Information Technology, Risk Management, Engineering, or related field required (experience and certifications may substitute for degree)
* 5+ years’ experience as a compliance officer, risk manager/analyst, or related position
* Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), and/or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) preferred
* Experience with compliance frameworks (e.g., ISO27001/27017/27018, SOC, GDPR or similar)
* Proven success in the risk management and compliance field
* Accountable to work independently with minimum supervision.
* Previous experience with software tools like Safe Base, Loopio and Jira a plus
* Previous experience with cloud infrastructure products and software development a plus

  

**Competencies:*** Problem solving/analysis
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Personal effectiveness/credibility
* Time management
* Presentation skills
* Planning and execution

**What you will get:*** Day one benefits. Coverage starts on day one. We offer competitive medical insurance, health and dependent care spending accounts, health savings account, disability insurance, and company paid and voluntary life insurance.
* Balanced life. We offer employees generous paid time-off policies, parental leave, holiday schedule, and a flexible work environment; MacStadium understands life also happens outside of work. Did we mention free company swag?
* Solid future. Beyond competitive salary and 401(k) matching, MacStadium offers continuing education, professional development, and wellness reimbursements.

*For California, Colorado, and Illinois applicants, the compensation range for this role is $100,000 to $120,000.*

title: SME - Computer and Information Systems Manager (100% Remote)
description:
**Company Description**  

Citizant is a leading provider of professional IT services to the U.S. government. We seek to address some of our country’s most pressing challenges in the areas of Agile application development, Enterprise Data Management, Enterprise Architecture, and Program Management support services – focusing on the U.S. Departments of Homeland Security and Treasury. We strive to hire only ethical, talented, passionate, and committed “A Players” who already align with the company’s core values: Drive, Excellence, Reputation, Responsibility, and a Better Future. No matter how large we grow, Citizant will retain its collaborative, supportive, small-company culture, where successful team effort to address external and internal customer challenges is valued above all individual contributions.

 **Job Description** **Overview:**


We are on the lookout for a Subject Matter Expert (SME) - Computer and Information Systems Manager to champion the IRS Applications Development (AD) Organization's technological advancements for an upcoming opportunity. This critical role is not just about managing IT systems; it's about envisioning and implementing a technological future that aligns with the IRS's strategic goals. The chosen candidate will navigate complex IT landscapes, spearhead the integration of innovative solutions, and ensure that technological implementations enhance operational efficiency, security, and compliance. With a focus on strategic technology planning, this role demands a visionary leader adept at transforming IT challenges into opportunities, ensuring the IRS remains at the cutting edge of technology and service delivery.

**Responsibilities:**

* Spearhead the evaluation and strategic integration of emerging technologies to foster innovation and efficiency across IRS operations.
* Lead the assessment and overhaul of existing IT infrastructures, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and future-readiness.
* Champion the development and execution of comprehensive IT strategies, aligning technology investments with organizational goals and compliance requirements.
* Cultivate strong partnerships with stakeholders, IT teams, and external vendors to ensure cohesive technology implementations and solutions.
* Guide the adoption and governance of IT best practices, standards, and methodologies, including Agile and DevOps, to enhance project delivery and operational excellence.
* Oversee the design and implementation of robust cybersecurity measures and data protection strategies, safeguarding sensitive information against emerging threats.
* Actively monitor technology trends and advancements, providing leadership and direction in the adoption of cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and other transformative technologies.
* Facilitate the continuous improvement of IT service delivery, ensuring systems and processes are efficient, user-centric, and capable of meeting evolving business needs.
* Lead educational and training initiatives to enhance team capabilities and foster a culture of technical excellence and innovation.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 5+ years of proven experience in IT management, showcasing a successful track record in the strategic implementation and oversight of complex IT projects.
* Strong technical proficiency in modern technologies such as cloud computing, cybersecurity, data analytics, and machine learning, demonstrating the ability to leverage these technologies in solving organizational challenges.
* Relevant professional certifications, including but not limited to Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), or AWS Certified Solutions Architect, highlighting specialized skills and a commitment to maintaining industry-standard expertise.
* Exceptional leadership qualities, with the ability to inspire and manage cross-functional teams, fostering an environment of collaboration and innovation.
* Comprehensive understanding of regulatory compliance standards relevant to the IT industry, particularly those impacting federal agencies, such as the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) frameworks, and General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for international considerations.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving skills, capable of anticipating future IT trends and their potential impact on organizational goals.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities, with a track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders at all levels, from technical teams to executive leadership.

**Education:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, underscoring a robust foundation in IT principles and practices.

**Clearance Requirement:**

* US Citizenship is Required
* Active Public Trust/MBI clearance or the ability to obtain one.

  

**Additional Information**  

Citizant strives to be an employer of choice in the Washington metropolitan area. Citizant associates accept challenging and rewarding work and in return receive excellent compensation and benefits, as well as the opportunity for personal and professional development.  

  

Citizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Director, Digital Product Manager – Air and Water (Remote)
description:
At GE Appliances, a Haier company, we come together to make “good things, for life.” As the fastest-growing appliance company in the U.S., we’re powered by creators, thinkers and makers who believe that anything is possible and that there’s always a better way. We believe in the power of our people and in giving them the freedom to explore, discover and build good things, together.
The GE Appliances philosophy, backed by three simple commitments defines the way we work, invent, create, do business, and serve our communities: *we come together*, *we always look for a better way*, and *we create possibilities*.
Interested in joining us on our journey?
The Digital Product Manager will identify ways to improve the value and experience of our consumers and business owners for our Air and Water product lines through digital upgrades both on-product and within our SmartHQ app. They will also bring to life digital partnerships with other leading brands in the digital space to expand our overall ecosystem. Finally, they will work within the industries to identify opportunities to apply new technologies to drive efficiencies and energy savings through digital enhancements.  

  

The role of Digital Product Manager for Air and Water Products will lead efforts to create a software-centric product roadmap that can be executed across multiple product platforms. Utilizing a customer-first mindset, agile principles and a strong understanding of both hardware and software interaction, this role will work within the Product Line teams to develop and implement digital strategies that accommodate the initial product launch, as well as, continual over the air enhancements. Ultimately, this role will translate the needs of the consumer, customer and business into digital opportunities with a focus on improving outcomes over time and driving both loyalty and brand reputation. The digital product manager role reports functionally into SmartHome and Energy Solutions but is dedicated to the HVAC, Retail AC , Commercial AC and Water Heater micro-enterprises (ME) and is responsible for helping to drive the vision and goals the micro-enterprises.
Position
Director, Digital Product Manager – Air and Water (Remote)
Location
USA, Louisville, KY
How You'll Create Possibilities
Objectives of this Role* Drive product features, service strategies and long-term vision to build best in class digital experience and enhancements for both on-product and within the SmartHQ App for the Air and Water micro-enterprises
* Research, develop and execute a software centric approach to life-cycle and energy management that will allow new product introductions (NPIs), hardware and services to be extensible across the micro-enterprise and larger business
* Utilize agile principles to develop new capabilities, partners and business models that support driving additional value for our appliance and business owners
* Evaluate, analyze, and understand data analytics and voice of the customer through a variety of data sources and translate into actionable insights and user experiences
* Identify outside ecosystems and coordinate digital partnership opportunities through cloud services, SDKs and APIs to maximize ecosystem benefit
* Conduct user research and usability studies, collaborate with designers, developers and research teams and translate those learnings into user stories that support intuitive product experiences
* Leverage the catalog of smart home capabilities and use as building blocks to coordinate ecosystem revenue growth and energy management across the Air and Water micro-enterprises, accelerate speed to market and create value faster
* Engage industry organizations to understanding leading trends and identify opportunities for applications of new digital enhancements to drive differentiation and leadership for our products
* Identify key catalysts that drive connections, connection rate and active users, as well as, being involved in IOT Thought leadership, brand building and driving our overall digital reputation


Daily and Monthly Responsibilities* Partner with product, mobile, embedded, UI/UX and cloud resources to scope and prioritize activities, manage the roadmap and backlog to ensure delivery of all capabilities on time and per specification
* Oversee and manage requirements discovery, solution design, user story writing, feature development, and user acceptance testing
* Work closely with product marketing to help develop positioning and messaging to ensure differentiation from competitors
* Partner with cross functional teams regularly to ensure alignment on feature development, prioritization and execution as well as identifying potential issues and solutions
* Monitor and evaluate digital product functions and SmartHQ app performance to create test and learn opportunities that evaluate new functions and features, assess customer feedback and work with cross-function team to execute or pivot as necessary.
* Collaborate with other product managers in the organization to expose future enhancements, identify global software features and develop digital ecosystem revenue opportunities


What You'll Bring to Our Team
Skills and Qualifications* Minimum 10 years of experience in digital product management or similar
* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field or relevant experience equivalent
* Experience working with Air & Water Product Lines & Product Launches or other related industry
* Usability and customer-focused design experience
* Digital Lifecycle Management and Solutions– Development of both specific and broad enterprise implementations.
* Working knowledge of digital architecture development, back-end and front-end development
* Experience using product management tools such as Zenhub, Jira, Etc.
* Passionate about change, building great products/services and solving customer and business problems and a strategic mindset to drive both short term and long-term goals
* Proven ability working in a matrixed environment with strong organizational skills.
* Exceptional communication skills, with a responsive and proactive approach.
* Experience working in an Agile environment


Preferred Qualifications* Masters degree
* Experience identifying and developing new partnerships with adjacent and non-adjacent industries
* Hardware & Software development experience such as experience writing SQL queries, experience with back-end and front-end programming languages, such as Java, HTML, CSS, Angular JS


Our Culture
At GE Appliances, creativity meets passion and conversations lead to exceptional outcomes and experiences. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that everyone brings to GE Appliances. We believe a diverse workplace, where everyone is included and people can be their true and authentic selves, fosters creativity and innovation. We know our differences are our greatest strength. The very best innovations across every function of a company come from diverse teams. Our commitment to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone is valued allows employees to perform at their best, every day. Diversity at GE Appliances helps us achieve zero distance to our owners, innovate smartly and connect to the communities and customers we serve. We encourage and support the ideas, aspirations, and the wellbeing of everyone - our employees and our communities
GE Appliances is a trust-based organization. It is important we offer our employees the flexibility they need to do their best work while balancing the needs of the business and individuals. When you join GE Appliances, you will have the opportunity to work with your leader to create a flexible work arrangement that balances the needs of the individual, team, and organization.
GE Appliances is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
GE Appliances participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S*If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply, please send an e-mail* *to ask.recruiting@geappliances.com*

title: Data Migration Supervisor
description:
We are the leading provider of professional services to the middle market globally, our purpose is to instill confidence in a world of change, empowering our clients and people to realize their full potential. Our exceptional people are the key to our unrivaled, inclusive culture and talent experience and our ability to be compelling to our clients. You’ll find an environment that inspires and empowers you to thrive both personally and professionally. There’s no one like you and that’s why there’s nowhere like RSM.


We are looking for a Data Migration professional with experience working within a team setting to design, deploy, and support technical solutions.  

  



**The team:**

You will be working with a national team with a client base that extends across the United States, many of which have a global footprint. Our Data Engineering services (DE) team members have served in both consulting and industry roles and specialize in helping organizations deploy repeatable, scalable, and sustainable solutions that save time and resources. Our Data Migration sub-function is focused on ERP, CRM, and other Business Application data migrations from and to one or many different applications.


We have experienced rapid growth and maintain a strong pipeline of interesting and challenging projects. Our team is constantly looking for ways to develop our delivery methods, technical solutions, and grow our client skillsets through certifications and regular training opportunities. We expect that our team members will contribute to these efforts in addition to their client responsibilities.


Our team strives to be first-choice advisors and well-rounded individuals both at work and out of the office. We enjoy meeting virtually and in person at RSM-sponsored events, participating in firm’s CDI (culture, diversity, and inclusion) groups, and innovating using emerging technologies. We also focus on maintaining a healthy work-life balance while managing our client obligations.


**Responsibilities:**

* Partner closely with RSM NetSuite Business Application teams on new client opportunities and support pre-sales and sales activities
* Collaborate with client business, data, technical, project management, and partner teams to build relationships, deliver complex NetSuite data migration projects, and explore new solutions to their problems/challenges
* Document the scope, create estimates, and form timelines for external client projects based on a set of assumptions and dependencies gathered through survey, individual interview, virtual or in person workshops, and data profiling
* Draft and drive Statements of Work (SOWs), be the key point of contact to client executive sponsors, complete independence and conflict checks with internal compliance teams with the support of Partners and Directors
* Manage engagement financials and project plans to ensure on budget and on time delivery
* Work with data in both 3NF and Star Schemas, define data mappings, reference data, and data lineage of attributes of data entities
* Develop and demonstrate technical solutions using some of the following technologies and languages (with plenty of opportunity to explore new technical solutions):



	+ Oracle NetSuite
	+ T-SQL and Python
	+ SQL Server Database Engine, Azure SQL Database, or Azure SQL Managed Instance
	+ Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory (ADF)
	+ Power BI Desktop & Service
	+ Tableau Desktop & Server
	+ Alteryx Designer & Server
	+ Snowflake Data Cloud
	+ Github Repositories
	+ Azure DevOps, Atlassian Jira
* Triage and resolve bugs/defects, manage Quality Assurance (QA) and test plans
* Complete certifications in various frameworks, technologies, and methodologies
* Act as a leader on practice management efforts, participate in future hiring, performance management, and personal development plans for new team members
* Author digital written, video, and audio content such as how to articles, white papers, release notes, and other content intended to be posted on RSM’s website or Industry Journals
* Be open and willing to other project types, learning new technologies, and broadening your skillset.
* Travel to client sites as needed

**Basic qualifications:**

* Bachelors or graduate degree with an emphasis in Computer Science or Information Systems
* Experience leading the data migration process for Oracle NetSuite ERP in greenfield and brownfield deployments
* Experience utilizing NetSuite Data Import using CSV
* Experience utilizing NetSuite SOAP Web Services
* Experience utilizing NetSuite Saved Searches
* Minimum 6 years in a data focused role
* At least 2 years of experience leading teams
* Technical Certifications in your tool stack of choice
* Non-Technical Certifications in your industry of choice

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Understanding of NetSuite functional areas
* Understanding of how to automate business processes and customize NetSuite
* Understanding of how to analyze data and run reports in NetSuite
* Understanding of how to set up, manage, and maintain NetSuite

At RSM, we offer a competitive benefits and compensation package for all our people. We support and inspire you to prioritize your wellbeing by delivering personalized, holistic programming for your physical, emotional, financial and community wellbeing. RSM has a generous time off policy with at least 14 paid holidays, wellbeing days and associate and above access to self-managed time off. We offer flexibility in your schedule, empowering you to balance life’s demands, while also maintaining your ability to serve clients. Learn more about our total rewards at https://rsmus.com/careers/working-at-rsm/benefits .


RSM is proud to be an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We are proud to provide our employees with tools to assist them in being successful in achieving both personal and professional goals. We welcome and support all our employees to thrive in an environment free of discrimination and harassment. As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer all applicants will receive consideration for employment as RSM does not tolerate discrimination and/or harassment based on race; color; creed; sincerely held religious beliefs, practices or observances; sex (including pregnancy or disabilities related to nursing); gender (including gender identity and/or gender expression); sexual orientation; HIV Status; national origin; ancestry; familial or marital status; age; physical or mental disability; citizenship; political affiliation; medical condition (including family and medical leave); domestic violence victim status; past, current or prospective service in the US uniformed service; pre-disposing genetic characteristics or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.


Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process and/or employment/partnership. RSM is committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application, interview, or otherwise participate in the recruiting process, please call us at 800-274-3978 or send us an email at careers@rsmus.com .


RSM does not intend to hire entry level candidates who will require sponsorship now OR in the future (i.e. F-1 visa holders). However, those candidates who may be recent U.S. college / university graduates possessing 1-2 years of progressive and relevant work experience, excluding internships, in the U.S. or his/her home country would be eligible for hire as an experienced candidate and thus eligible for sponsorship.


Compensation Range: $105,300 - $210,500

title: Sr. IT Manager
description:
**ABOUT US**



OLIPOP was founded in 2017 by Ben Goodwin and David Lester. Ben and David have been working together for nearly a decade to find accessible solutions to bring the benefits of digestive health to as many consumers as possible. OLIPOP is a deliciously refreshing tonic that is crafted with prebiotics, botanicals, and natural plant fiber to support your microbiome and benefit digestive health. We're on a mission to provide an affordable, delicious alternative to soda that delivers leading-edge health benefits to mainstream consumers.


**OUR TEAM**



At Olipop our values lead the way we create our products, engage with each other, and interact with our community. While we're invested in our product, we're equally invested in personal development. We're tightly knit, we're genuine and we're always pushing the envelope to do a better job than we did the day before. Our team is also fully remote, requiring us to be resourceful, creative and collaborative to support our fast-moving business.



To best serve our diverse community of customers, we also seek to recruit and include people with a diversity of abilities, backgrounds, and cultures.


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**



Working at a start-up can be as much a personal journey as it is a professional one. To succeed at a company like Olipop, you must be comfortable with failing, learning, and adapting. You need to be curious, optimistic, and able to find a way when it seems impossible. You must be confident enough to express your ideas but humble and open to learning from your experiences and from others. If this is the approach you take to life, then we'd love to hear from you.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Collaborate with our leadership team and outside vendors to establish, measure, and define IT goals and maintain an IT roadmap.
* Define and lead the implementation of company procedures, controls and policies.
* Set standards for the organization and oversee acquiring, implementing, and operating hardware, software and storage.
* Manage IT system upgrades, maintenance, new installations and migrations, and establish timeframes for major IT initiatives.
* Establish a security policy and implement procedures and controls that protect company information and resources.
* Facilitate IT security audits or investigations and oversee implementation of any improvements.
* Establish and maintain backup procedures for all systems to ensure protection from loss of data and ensure backups are carried out in accordance with company policy.
* Provide support to our remote team to resolve technical challenges, and design training programs and opportunities for team training and skills advancement.
* Continually develop and evaluate new technologies and tools for the company.
* Provide a cost/benefit analysis for technology spending and initiatives to our Leadership team through clear and consistent communication. Manage and report on allocation of IT budget.
* Serve as the point of contact for IT vendor management.
* Partner with Human Resources and local office administration to handle confidential matters.
* Develop the overall IT strategy (i.e. asset management, computer and information systems, security, communication systems, etc.).
* Develop, implement, and evaluate IT projects in line with the organizational strategy and objectives.
* Manage and oversee all stages of the development lifecycle for new and existing projects while working to deliver them on schedule and on budget.
* Liaison with cross-functional departments to identify business and technology needs.
* Monitor and report on IT service and system performance and identify and implement any corrective actions as necessary.
* Ensure issues reported by employees are resolved in a timely manner.
* Plan and manage the growth of in-office technology (including networking, teleconferencing, A/V, intranet, and other systems).

  

  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* 8+ years of experience managing and leading IT operations including supervising technology team members and vendors, managing key information technology projects, and overseeing data and reporting infrastructure. Preferably within cloud-centric, highly collaborative, remote environments.
* Excellent working knowledge of computer systems, security, networking, systems administration, asset management and data storage systems- including but not limited to: Apple laptops and related technologies, Google Workspace, and Microsoft Office applications. Working knowledge of Netsuite and Shopify is preferred.
* Strong troubleshooting, analytical and problem solving skills.
* Ability to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions for all aspects of the organization.
* Ability to manage a budget and exercise fiscal responsibility.
* Ability to quickly assess work for areas of risk, identify gaps and recommend areas for improvement.
* Experience communicating, escalating, and providing solutions to senior leadership, while balancing business expectations.
* Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, and/or a related field.
* Ability to develop strong partnerships with internal stakeholders, external vendors and contractors.
* Experience in vendor and managed service selection and relationship management.
* Significant experience managing all phases of the development lifecycle.
* Experience in being scrappy to bring capabilities as they make sense for business.

  


**REPORTING TO:** Chief Financial Officer

  


**COMPENSATION:** $130,000-$140,000 base salary + bonus


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Olipop does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please see EEO is the Law.
