title: Computer and Information Systems Manager (Hybrid/Remote)
description:
Description:
**Job Summary:**


Plan and coordinate activities in such fields as electronic data processing, information systems, systems analysis, and computer programming. Provide computer and information systems operations, analyzing workflow, establishing priorities, developing standards and setting deadlines. Assign and review the work of contractor systems analysts, programmers, and other computer-related workers. Review project plans to plan and coordinate project activity.

**Essential Job Functions:**


Relevant experience in some or all of the below fields is desired:

* Writing operating system scripts and/or COTS word processing, spreadsheet, and database application macros;
* Writing code in current versions of standard procedural and/or object oriented programming languages;
* Operating and/or programming relational data base management systems (RDBMS);
* Translating broad information technology needs into plans and standards (Specific MIL-STD-498 experience is desirable);
* Executing advanced and administrative operating system operations;
* Performing a variety of operations in client/server and/or cluster environment;
* Providing advanced technical hardware and operating system software knowledge and recommendations to system designers, planners, and owners/operators. Advising application operations and database teams on operating systems issues and challenges in order to capture, store, maintain,
* Some travel maybe required. This may entail inspection trips to the Fleet Readiness Centers (FRCs) or vendor's plants. It may require management of research and development, test and evaluation of work in the Navy and industry laboratories under NAVAIR funded programs.

**Other Job Functions:**


Other duties as assigned.


Requirements:
**Qualifications/Education/Experience/Skills:**


MS or MA degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or Mathematics is required. A BS and additional years may substitute for an MS.


Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.


At least ten (10) years of relevant experience to the essential job functions listed above.

**Physical Requirements:**


While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit, walk, see, hear, and feel. Occasionally will need to lift and move up to 50lbs. Moderate lab environment temperature and noise level. Must be able to interpret data, information, and documents. Can learn and apply new information and skills.

**Benefits:**


Compass Systems, Inc. is a profitable, growing company offering excellent salaries and benefits. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program including 401(k), medical, vision, Rx, dental, short and long-term disability, life insurance and recruitment incentives.

***Compass Systems Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veteran status. Use of any external recruitment or job placement agency is based upon its compliance with our commitment to equal opportunity and affirmative action.***

title: Senior Administrator - Information Systems Supervisor
description:
Overview:

POSITION TITLE (Oracle title)


SENIOR ADMINISTRATOR

  

WORKING TITLE


Information Systems Supervisor

  

SCHOOL/DEPARTMENT


Facilities Design and Construction (FD&C)

  

LOCATION


Crossroads III, Cary, NC

  

PAY GRADE


Senior Administrator-Band 3

  

FLSA STATUS


Exempt

  

ELIGIBILITY FOR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT


No

  

WORK WEEK SCHEDULE


Monday-Friday (occasional evenings and weekends) Position is available for a Hybrid Telework workweek

  

POSITION PURPOSE:


Researches, collects, disseminates, manages, and presents graphical and statistical data. Develops and maintains the Wake County Public School System’s Information Systems for FD&C.

  

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES (KSAs)

* Considerable knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; Google Apps;
* Working knowledge of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requirements;
* Effective organizational, leadership, and management skills;
* Ability to be proactive and apply technical knowledge to improve deliverables, providing attention to detail to minimize errors;
* Ability to effectively management documents;
* Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both in oral and written form using a variety of communication techniques and tools to ensure the appropriate flow of information, collaborative efforts, and feedback;
* Ability to accurately read, interpret and comply with WCPSS and departmental procedures;
* Ability to work well within a team environment that values an open exchange of ideas;
* Ability to interact positively and effectively with diverse group of stakeholders (e.g. design professionals, contractors, inspectors, principals, teachers, parents, other school system staff).

  

EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field from an accredited university or college; AND
* Experience in the field of information systems and web management; AND
* Experience with Java, Power BI, Web design/support, Oracle or similar systems, document management; information management for a large organization/corporation; research and statistical analysis; and experience in database development and management; AND
* Experience in network management and computer applications, including use of Microsoft Access, Web design, and SQL Database skills; AND
* Experience supervising staff and leading teams;
* An equivalent combination of education and relevant experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job.

  

CERTIFICATION AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS

* Must hold and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator’s license according to the State of NC requirements.

  

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

* Master’s degree in MIS or related field;
* Database/web management certification.

  

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Responsible for developing and implementing management of information systems policies, procedures, and initiatives. Identifies, analyzes, and develops improvements in processes, productivity, quality, internal client relationships, and customer service.
* Focuses on new or evolving systems, implementation projects, and collaboration with other department staff and information technology professionals to support system configuration and operations. Works with vendors, users and technical staff to ensure solutions attained are intended user functionality and goals. Provides scheduled and ad-hoc reports on a variety of information and statistics relevant to the general operations of the department.
* Evaluates software tools to manage the organization’s business schema; identifies essential information systems management needs and coordinates with all necessary functions to ensure that the timing and capability to meet the needs of the major capital projects from early program development to construction closeout.
* Performs systems administration, data collection, and report generation.
* Develops and manages FD&C Information Systems such as:


	+ Project Management Software (Kahua) and Primavera P6 Scheduling (Web Based);
	+ FD&C web site.
	+ ArcGIS
* Acts as a consultant to department managerial and support staff on all software programs and tools.
* Develops, coordinates, and conducts training to internal and external staff, vendors, and other stakeholders.
* Procures and manages contracts, as necessary, for continuing development of FD&C Information Systems.
* Coordinates the maintenance of, and makes recommendations on upgrades, as necessary, to the network and computer system for Facilities, Design and Construction.
* Performs other related duties, as assigned.

  

WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS


This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The position, at times, must be able to come into direct contact with school system staff and staff members. Work is considered light physical work, requiring the exertion of up to ten pounds of force. The work occasionally requires driving automotive equipment.


EFFECTIVE DATE: 6/2023

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this position. They are not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required by the employees assigned to this position. This description may be revised by HR and approved at any time.

title: Project Manager
description:
Description:

Zen Strategics, a niche Cyber Security and Records Management/CUI firm, is looking for a **Project Manager** for a Records Information Management contract. The Project Manager shall have full authority to act for the contractor on all contract matters relating to performance of the staff provided on the contract.

* The Project Manager shall work through the COR to resolve contractual issues, receive technical instructions, and ensure adequate performance of services.
* Leads and coordinates efforts to align system capabilities and technical specifications with functional and policy requirements.
* Applies analytical processes to the planning, configuration, and implementation of


electronic information system controls.

* Collaborates with desktop systems administrators, system security, and other IT stakeholders to support records management and CUI technical and business requirements.
* Provides customer consultation and advisory services to respond to IT Change Configuration Board inquiries or issues involving software configuration and controls.
* Works with technical support personnel to provide consultation and instruction on all electronic records management system requirements


Requirements:

Must possess experience and skill requirements including knowledge and expert ability to work closely with the Division of Information Systems and other technical experts to configure electronic records management controls for systems, tools, and


applications that handle federal information, data, and records.

* Must have expert technical skills to perform electronic records management systems audits for compliance with records management statutory and regulatory requirements.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or 5 or more years related IT experience.
* Possess 2 or more years’ experience as Team Lead or Supervisor.
* Strong analysis, critical thinking, and analytical problem-solving skills.
* Experience with project management methodologies.
* Experience planning and implementing desktop applications, SaaS and other third party systems and services.
* Ability to understand record schedules and apply to file plan development.


Zen Strategics is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Asset and Configuration Management Process and Technology Manager
description:
We Are Hiring:* **Department:** Technology Business Operations
* **Schedule:** Full time
* **Location:** Remote


What You Will Do:

As a member of the Service Asset and Configuration Management team, the **Asset and Configuration Management Process and Technology Manager** plays a crucial role in our operational excellence strategy and is the process owner responsible for asset and configuration management processes, services and capabilities. Leverage your experience to partner with cross-functional ITSM and technical professionals to continuously improve and deliver critical foundational solutions across the Ascension IT landscape.


Has the ability and authority to deliver the strategic roadmap and the daily end-to-end Service Asset and Configuration Management (SACM) services in accordance with the SACM Plan.

**Responsibilities**

* Establish and maintain the Service, Asset and Configuration Management Strategy and Roadmap based on business, service and operational customers needs and strategies
* Establish and maintain Asset and CMDB architectural standards in alignment with the ServiceNow Common Service Data Model (CSDM) and provide prescriptive guidance on service modeling within the Asset and CMDB in support of scalability, automation, and time to value of the Now Platform
* Provide direction for the work of multiple analysts and mentor the organization on asset and configuration management services, concepts, policies and procedures, compliance and resolution/escalation of issues.
* Oversee AMDB/CMDB support services, to include requests to provision and deprovision CI’s and assets, and regular maintenance work such as CI discovery, identification and control, status accounting and reporting.
* Has the ability and authority to deliver the strategic roadmap and the daily end-to-end Service Asset and Configuration Management (SACM) services in accordance with the SACM Plan.
* Develop and maintain Ascension’s configuration models for services, assets, applications and infrastructure to enable key processes such as impact and cause of incident and problems, change planning and design and change risk and impact assessment, planning tech refreshes, software upgrades, optimize asset utilization by understanding which CI’s make up a service, enable service health reporting via service mapping
* Establish and build relationships with other ITIL process owners, applicable tool owners and stakeholders to understand business objectives, data structure, and how CMDB and Asset Management processes will best support the enterprise and process specific objectives.
* Facilitate communication and engage business and IT management to support SACM efforts and value proposition.
* Act as subject matter expert to support service design and service transition methodologies while engaging with strategic projects to ensure SACM can deliver required functionality within project timeframe
* Continually improve process execution using automated means wherever possible and clearly document responsibilities and expectations of Service Owners or other stakeholders where manual maintenance is necessary.
* Inform the day-to-day activities of the process, including establishing priorities and work assignments
* Facilitate SACM annual maturity assessments
* Review critical incident outage resolution results and responses and dispositions of failed changes due to Configuration Management System (CMS) related issues
* Reviews and approves all changes to the CMS application and/or infrastructure where applicable
* Reviews significant IT infrastructure changes to ensure impacts to configuration management data are properly addressed
* Collaborate with ServiceNow platform management team to establish and support integration points such as Ascension Data lake, financial systems, IT Service Continuity systems, SolarWinds and capacity planning for the ServiceNow platform.
* Provides or reviews all requirements, use cases, user stories, etc. in support of new or improving functionality of the Asset and Configuration Management systems
* Reviews and publishes configuration management reporting.
* Oversee and support asset and configuration management system testing activities
* Experience integrating and operating Software License Management platforms such as Flexera preferred
* Recommend cost-effective hardware/software solutions.


What You Will Need:

Licensure / Certification / Registration:* Certification credentialed from the International Association of Information Technology Asset Managers preferred.


Education:* High School diploma equivalency with 3 years of cumulative experience OR Associate's  

degree/Bachelor's degree with 2 years of cumulative experience OR 7 years of applicable cumulative job specific experience required.
* 3 years of leadership or management experience preferred.


Additional Preferences:
* 10 years progressive experience in IT in relevant fields
* At least 4 years of experience leading CDMB/AMDB deployment and operations in Global Information Technology environment or large enterprise with diverse infrastructures and application portfolios. Certifications strongly preferred
* 5+ years leadership minimum
* Experience with ServiceNow platform, or similar tool, certifications strongly preferred
* Proven ability to provide thought leadership and design data structures across multiple domains and a system of management controls to maintain correctness, completeness and compliance
* Experience delivering measurable outcomes, performance consistency and reporting results to key process partners and stakeholders
* Demonstrate ability to measure and show value creation to the business through process efficiency, automation and ITSM process integration
* ITIL V3/V4 Foundation preferred with at least 6 years’ experience leveraging ITSM and ITOM best practices supported by a Configuration Management System
* Understanding of SDLC and various development and project methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, DevOps, CI/CD, etc.
* Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or equivalent preferred

title: IT Engineering & Technology Lead
description:
Position Summary:
Zoetis, the world leader in animal health, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced IT Engineering & Technology Team Lead to join our team. In this role, you will maintain oversight of existing platform upgrades and support as well as evaluation/approval of new IT technologies for implementation within our organization. You will be responsible for managing a team of IT Engineers who focus on COTS Applications, Custom Coding, Data, and Emerging Technologies (AI, ML, IoT, VR, AR, etc.) that implement digital solutions for global research and development. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, exceptional leadership abilities, an awareness of corporate finances, and excellent communication skills.
Responsibilities:
Management:* Manage and mentor a team of engineers, providing guidance, support, and performance feedback.
* Collaborate with senior management to define and manage IT budgets, resource capacity, and investment plans as well as prioritize workload to deliver on time/within budget for all approved demand.
* Maintain IT technology roadmaps aligned with goals, strategies, and technology initiatives with global R&D long-term goals.


Technical:* Collaborate with IT teams to implement technology solutions using existing technologies and new emerging technologies.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and evaluate their potential impact on our business.
* Ensure legacy systems stay updated to support ongoing business operations.


I
Education & Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technology field
* Advanced degrees or certifications in technology are a plus.
* Minimum 8+ years of experience in a closely related field and role
* Experience with emerging technologies such as AI, ML, IoT, VR, AR, etc.
* Experience with agile development methodologies
* Experience with cloud platforms, data analytics, and software development


Knowledge, Skills, Ability Requirements:* Ability to communicate and work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, developers, engineers, designers, business stakeholders, and project managers, to foster a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and delivery ownership.
* Ability to lead and influence teams to ensure a proper balance of time and money is allocated to new and existing technologies.
* Ability to analyze complex problems, identify suitable emerging technology solutions, and translate them into actionable plans.
* Ability to mentor teams to grow future leaders.


Travel: Minimal, <5%

title: Information System Security Manager
description:
The Columbia Group (TCG), is a technical services support company which has a successful 50+ year history of providing United States government with acquisition, logistics management, engineering, design, fabrication, test and evaluation, information technology and financial management support services. As a full-time employee of TCG, you will receive a comprehensive benefits package to include a quality health insurance program (medical, drug, vision and dental) for you and your family, group life insurance, group short and long-term disability insurance, a 401K profit sharing retirement plan, and professional development opportunities. You will accrue 'Paid Time Off' (PTO) to be used towards vacation or sick leave, in addition to receiving eleven (11) paid federal holidays.


We are seeking to hire an **Information System Security Manager** to join our team working remotely and occasionally in the Alexandria, VA office. Upon award, you will:


* Serve as Information System Security Manager for International Navy financial system.
* Follow Risk Management Framework process to obtain ATO for financial database application.
* Provide support for Assessment and Authorization (A&A) activities, in accordance with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Risk Management Framework (RMF), to obtain and maintain Authority to Operate.
* Identify and complete applicable Defense Information Security Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIG) checklists.
* Address and resolve findings from Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS) Nessus scan results provided by network hosting team.
* Provide monitoring of cyber threats and incident response according to CIO instructions, with digital forensics tools capability.

title: Managers
description:
**We'd Love to See:**

Job Description
  

Managers for various and unanticipated worksites throughout the US (HQ: Chicago, IL). Manage analytical service operations for mortgage and tenant screening businesses by overseeing a team of data scientist consultants. Design and develop software to mine large datasets and develop predictive scoring models. Predict risk and marketing outcomes by developing statistical models, including decision trees and scorecards. Generate insights using data query software such as SQL and Tableau. Recommend policy and account changes to customers in response to predicted changes in market and economic environments. Develop and deploy software for compiling licensed residential housing data and use compiled data to create derivative products. Provide training and mentorship to direct reports. Technical Environment: SQL, R, SAS, Python (Scipy, pandas, numpy, Ipython), Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access, Tableau, Spotfire, Knime, Alteryx, Regression Analysis, Classification, Decision Trees.
  

Job Requirements
  

  

\\*Master’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a Consultant, or in Statistical Data Modeling required. Required skills: SQL, R, SAS, Python (Scipy, pandas, numpy, Ipython), Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Access, Tableau, Spotfire, Knime, Alteryx, Regression Analysis, Classification, Decision Trees. Telecommuting permitted. (\\*Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field plus 5 years of progressive experience in the job offered, as a Consultant, or in Statistical Data Modeling also acceptable).

title: Program Manager Cloud Engineering Computer and Information Systems Manager
description:
We are looking for a Cloud Project Manager that will be responsible DHS Cloud Engineering and Operations tenant projects, reporting and metrics.
### **Description**


The Cloud PM will oversee all customer migrations (from data centers to DHS GovCloud), serve as the primary customer interface and conduct meetings / track progress. While the Cloud PM is primarily responsible for managing project delivery of cloud migration work (Azure and AWS) with 30+ customer tenants, there are additional responsibilities. The Cloud PM is responsible for creating and tracking all Cloud Engineering and Operations work in Jira, managing contract deliverables (weekly and monthly reports), presenting and conducting customer meetings, as well as other related duties as assigned. A passion for performance, strong desire for quality conformance, and attention to detail are prerequisites for this position.  

The applicant will report on progress throughout the performance period and ensure the engineering team and tasks are aligned with the Customer objectives and agreed timelines. Working to empower the tenants with all approved Cloud (Azure and AWS) offerings, best practices, and modernization to our Customer’s Program and overall experience.  

Key Responsibilities* Overall responsibility for all financial, technical, administrative, contractual, and personnel aspects of the Cloud Engineering Tenant Support contract and will interface with Customer executives.
* Be prepared to provide sound advice as to prioritizing projects or tasks and when to delay.
* Change and Configuration Management best practices
* Enforce quality standards for engineered solutions.
* Cross functional communication.
* Effective operating organization and talent development.
* World class program and project execution
* Efficient and effective solution delivery process.
* Issue escalation to internal and external stakeholders where appropriate.
* Promote continuous improvement.

  

Requirements* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Business Administration Science, Mathematics, or Engineering or a related field
* 3 Years of IT Experience in managing, building, operating, and improving Cloud Computing environments in Azure or AWS.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to interact and be involved with customers (tenants), client negotiations and interfacing with senior management
* Experience leading and collaborating with technical teams of diverse IT related skill sets
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of Azure and AWS Cloud environments and deploying in Government environments.
* Extensive knowledge of managing work in Jira (or similar work tracking systems) and ability to prepare useful reports to foster data-driven decision making.
* Exemplary communication, analytical skills, and technical knowledge across the client environment that facilitates resolving technical issues in customer cloud migrations.
* Ability to produce concise and clear technical documentation.
* Other position-related duties as assigned
* US Citizen

  

Desired Certifications (not required)* PMP
* Agile methodology certification
* Cloud practitioner-level certs for Azure and AWS

  

Security Level Required* Public Trust

  


#### **Salary**


$160,000 - $180,000 per year

title: Mgr- Franchise Performance - Atlanta
description:
We are Subway Headquarters! A dedicated team of professionals supporting thousands of franchisees around the globe.
  
  

Hungry for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there.
  
We are looking for Manager, Franchise Performance to support the Atlanta, GA area.
  
The Manager, Franchise Performance will provide strategic business direction and alignment in order to influence Subway franchise owners in maximizing profitability of their portfolio and help to align store operating procedures to Subway's brand standards. This role will communicate the expected performance level of the locations and franchisees within their assigned area in relation to the company's KPIs and metrics. They will implement business growth by identifying potential operational opportunities for improvement and provide training to strengthen locations.
  
  

**Position responsibilities include but are not limited to:**  

* Provide operational and food safety guidance and education during restaurant visits: Consistently evaluate SUBWAY restaurants using the PBE model on quarterly basis.
* Document adherence to Company compliance standards, improvements made, areas of opportunity and direction on how to improve, if needed during coaching sessions.
* Evaluate how the restaurant is performing compared to SUBWAY policies and procedures, analyze sales and cost data and provide specific customized direction to improve in these areas.
* Review franchisees portfolio and have regularly scheduled business reviews to see growth potential and areas of opportunity.
* Coach and counsel franchisees to reach individual store and territory goals.
* Provide guidance to franchisees to grow their business both within the local community in store and though online sales and delivery.
* Build Territory Relations by visiting all assigned restaurants at least quarterly depending on performance level, communicating with franchisees via voicemail, e-mail, territory meetings, individual franchise meetings and written communications.
* Gains respect from franchisees to be recognized as an asset to the business and leader in the field.
* Assist Territory Director and shared services team with site reviews by conducting three day parts of customer intercepts for all reviews within assigned area
* Provide direction and proficiency to franchisees and staff with regard to New Store Openings & Transfer Training Hours


**The successful candidate will have:**  

* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Communications, Business Analysis or related field preferred.
* 3+ years of restaurant experience preferred.
* The ability to learn technology initiatives and cascade this knowledge to others.
* Excellent written and verbal communication,
* Ability to problem solve and business analysis skills.
* High degree of detail orientation and ability to work within a team, hands on approach during in restaurant visits.
* Must also be able to work autonomously and be professional.


AA/EOE/M/F/D/V
  
  

The Company is only considering applicants who are currently authorized to work in the country the position is based. AA/EOE/M/F/D/V

title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (IT) DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
description:
**IT DEVELOPMENT MANAGER**




**ARE YOU A HIGHLY SKILLED INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY MANAGER WHO IS PASSIONATE ABOUT LEVERAGING YOUR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE TO HELP CHANGE LIVES?**

Robbins Research International (RRI), a Tony Robbins company, is looking for a highly-skilled **INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY** (**IT) DEVELOPMENT MANAGER** to join our world-class team. This role is perfect for a high-level, individual contributor with deep experience as a technical leader.


**OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE**

Our ideal candidate is an enthusiastic leader with skills to connect to their team members – leading by example, past experiences and team awareness in a fast-paced environment are critical to this role, our teams and company ecosystem. To thrive as a team lynchpin, you must be approachable and open-minded, welcoming ideas from the entire team while engaging team members.




Technical skillset is paramount in this role, as our next IT Development Manager will you will ensure our development team and partners stay deeply connected to goals by broadcasting customer needs, customer feedback, product roadmaps, and product KPIs.




**CORE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

Leadership




* Employ product and project management skills to collaborate on product road-mapping, project planning, and deliverables
* Ability to see the big picture but also able to navigate the details.
* Getting direction from organization's executive leadership and planning & executing based on strategic objectives and priorities.
* Ability to assess priorities and provide responses in timely manner.
* Ability to communicate clearly; verbally and written in timely fashion.
* Ability to always provide executive level summary and status of projects.
* Leading by example by showing strong commitment, reliability and truthfulness.
* Strong sense of accountability for and ownership of assigned projects.
* Demonstrate cooperation with other units in the organization and represent IT team as a single point of contact.




Technical




* Salesforce development experience critical
* Analytical with ability to suggest alternative solutions with explanation of benefits and disadvantages of different options.
* Leading a team of highly technical individuals and be responsible for product deliverables, resource management, budget and timelines.
* Ability to clearly describe technical processes in simpler terms to other teams in summary format.
* Ability to monitor multiple complex technology projects with proper use of resources.
* Ability to assess risks and roadblocks; communicate those to the leadership.
* Awareness of technical trends and competition in the industry.
* Significant previous experience in project life cycle; preferably with past experiences as a developer, and technical lead and functional manager.
* Understanding of agile development, sprints and delivering software with high quality, reliability and scalability. Well-versed in the practices of DevOps, combining software engineering and IT operations. Experience and understanding of modern stacks.
* Strong technology affinity and experience, as well as attention to detail and the ability to design, execute and maintain strategic goals and metrics.
* Easily recognizes areas for internal improvement and develops plans for implementation.
* Identify gaps/risks early and establish mitigation plans (both technically & with regards to resources)
* Experience in working with Information Technology teams in integration projects; ability to work on dependencies such as operating systems, API libraries, SDKs and exchanging user identity information between systems.
* Experience and understanding of structured programming languages (e.g., C#/C++/C/Java), platforms (e.g., Heroku), web services (e.g., AWS), frameworks (e.g., React Native) and client (e.g., React) & server-side development (e.g., Express.js).
* Experience in development of solutions in cloud computing platforms, networks, security and databases (e.g., MS SQL, PostgreSQL).
* Experience with software development tracking in collaborative environments (e.g., git, Azure DevOps Server and Asana)




QA and Documentation

* Performs quality assurance on large projects, including areas of estimations, design, architecture, and code reviews.
* Ensures creation of technical documentation to support development of the solution.
* Coordinates with infrastructure, external vendors, and other parties to ensure holistic solutions to meet business requirements.
* Refines application development processes (standardization/consistency, configuration management, release management, documentation)
* Develops and maintains technical knowledge and documentation for each of the business applications.
* Evaluates on premise applications for cloud migration feasibility. Leads cloud migration projects for applications appropriate for the cloud.




Salesforce




* 3-4 years of Salesforce Development Experience
* Salesforce Certified Platform Developer (preferred)
* Experience with Salesforce Lightning Web Components
* Salesforce Community Experience
* Experience with Agile development methodologies
* Experience with JIRA or DevOpsDemonstrates some understanding of Apex, VisualForce, HTML, JavaScript
* Experience with customization on the Salesforce Lightning platform which should include: Lightning Components using the Lightning Design System framework, Apex, Apex data loader, and declarative platform tools (Process Builder, Visual Workflow, Lightning App Builder, etc.)




Required




* Bachelor; Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, Software Engineering
* 13+ years' experience in systems analysis and application program development; 5+ years managing teams.
* Experience implementing enterprise solutions.
* Experience with Snowflake, and Tableau.
* Experience running and coordinating with IT team to maintain secure applications




**COMPANY PROFILE**




At Robbins Research International, we don't sell widgets, we change lives. Our culture is about defying the odds. Everything we do is about adding more value to people's lives. Our goal is to redefine and create an extraordinary client experience in all personal development, sales and corporate seminars that cover a wide range of topics, from mental conditioning and personal achievement systems to communication and business mastery.




Tony Robbins has been transforming the lives of millions of people across the world for three and a half decades and has been honored by AMEX as one of 6 people in the world to help turn around their business.We are an established company with a 40-year track record as THE pioneers and premier name in the self-education and personal growth industry.


Our mission is to redefine and create an extraordinary client experience in all Tony Robbins personal development, sales and seminars that cover a wide range of topics, from mental conditioning and personal achievement systems to communication and business mastery.

title: Telecommunicator
description:
Business Unit:
Global Information Technology
Reporting To:
Manager, Communication and Collaboration Services
Shift:
EMEA/UK (Mar-Nov 1:30 pm – 10:30 pm IST / Nov-Mar 2:30 pm – 11:30 pm IST) (India)
About Russell Investments, Mumbai:
Russell Investments is a leading outsourced financial partner and global investment solutions firm providing a wide range of investment capabilities to institutional investors, financial intermediaries, and individual investors around the world. Building on an 87-year legacy of continuous innovation to deliver exceptional value to clients, Russell Investments works every day to improve the financial security of its clients. The firm is the world’s sixth-largest investment adviser, with $1 trillion in assets under advisement (as of June 30, 2022) and $288.3 billion in assets under management (as of March 31, 2023) for clients in 30 countries. Headquartered in Seattle, Washington in the United States, Russell Investments has offices around the world, including London, New York, Toronto, Sydney, Tokyo, Shanghai – and has opened a new office in Mumbai, India in June 2023.
Joining the new Mumbai office is an incredible opportunity to work closely with global stakeholders to support the technology and infrastructure that drives the investment and trading processes of a globally recognized asset management firm. Be one of the first to join this new team based out of Goregaon (East) in Mumbai and be a part of creating the foundation and culture for the firm’s growing operations in India. The Mumbai office operates 5-days a week from Monday to Friday with varying shifts to accommodate time zones around the world.
For more information, please visit https://www.russellinvestments.com.  

Job Description:
The Messaging and Telecommunications Supervisor leads a team of Messaging and Telecom Engineers. Responsibilities include, but is not limited to, managing, and maintaining Russell Investments’ enterprise messaging and telephony systems. The role requires working closely with IT teams and business stakeholders to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of Russell Investments’ communication systems. In addition, the Messaging and Telecommunications Supervisor will mentor, assign tasks, and be a technical escalation point for the team. The position will report to the Manager of Messaging and Collaboration to provide operational support of this critical IT Infrastructure service.  

Years of Experience
8-10 years of experience of Exchange and SBC infrastructure experience  

Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field in a medium to large organization
* Demonstrated experience where operating as part of an effective team/relationship is critical to the success of your role.
* Experience managing the support of MS Exchange platforms, MS Outlook configuration and Best Practices, and MS Unified Communications
* Possess deep technical expertise of MS Exchange Hybrid Infrastructure, Microsoft 365 Exchange Online, Enterprise Vault, RightFax, Veritas Merge1, Veritas Compliance Accelerator, Veritas Discovery Accelerator, SharePoint On-Prem, SharePoint Online
* Deep familiarity with standard messaging protocols (SMTP, IMAP, POP3, TLS)
* Technical knowledge of Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business 2019 is a plus
* Strong knowledge of Active Directory concepts including permissions, Distribution List configuration, Windows Server, PowerShell
* Knowledge of Server and Networking principles pertaining to enterprise environment
* General understanding of DHCP, DNS, Hardware Load Balancing and firewalls in an Enterprise environment
* Strong working knowledge of an Enterprise Telecommunications Infrastructure
* Demonstrate deep familiarity with standard telecommunications protocols (SIP, TLS)
* Demonstrate a strong knowledge of Ribbon Software Edition Session Border Controllers (SBCs) and the Linux operating system on which these virtualized SBCs run
* Demonstrate a strong knowledge of Ribbon SBC1000 SBC appliances, including integration with ISDN PRI lines, SIP, and analog ports
* Demonstrate a strong knowledge of Microsoft Teams concepts including Administration, Direct Routing, Voice Configuration, Auto Attendants, Call Queues, Voice Mail, Teams Policies, and administration of Teams via both the Graphical User Interface and PowerShell
* Administration and troubleshooting of Skype for Business 2019 is a plus
* Experience in IT service delivery using the ITIL framework
* Experience leading a team of Administrators/Engineers
  

Responsibilities* Tune and evolve Messaging and Collaboration services, to facilitate a stable and efficient communication platform for the Russell Investments’ lines of business.
* Open support tickets with vendors and work issues to completion to provide excellent standard of service. Escalate support tickets in a timely manner as appropriate.
* Provides input regarding scalability, capacity and performance as solutions grow.
* Maintain documentation on existing architectures, standards, policies, and procedures.
* Identify and implement technologies, service packs and hotfixes that will improve reliability and overall system stability for the Exchange and Unified Communications infrastructure environment.
* Managing problem resolution remediation tasks for issues that arise with post-production use of a new Messaging or Collaboration product.
* Maintain an instant and trending view of the health of the infrastructure
* Tune and evolve telecommunications services, to facilitate a stable and efficient communication platform for the Russell lines of business
* Administer, troubleshoot, and maintain Ribbon Software Edition Session Border Controllers (SBCs) and SBC1000 SBC appliances
* Participate in other IT projects and/or tasks as needed
* Provide daily operational support and oversight of the Messaging and Collaboration Team
  

Core Values* Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and collaboration skills with all levels of management
* Strong organizational skills including the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet frequent deadlines,
* Demonstrated proactive approach to problem-solving with strong judgment and decision-making capability.
* Highly resourceful and collaborative team-player, with the ability to also be independently effective and exude initiative and a sense of urgency.
* Exemplifies our customer-focused, action-oriented, results-driven culture.
* Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities, has a desire for continuous learning, and proposes solutions.
* Ability to act with discretion and maintain complete confidentiality.
* Dedicated to the firm’s values of non-negotiable integrity, valuing our people, exceeding client expectations, and embracing intellectual curiosity and rigor.

title: IT Technician
description:
If you are a current DSV employee and interested in a position in another country, please contact your Human Resource representative to discuss the process and requirements of applying.


Job Req Number: 78259  

Time Type: Full Time

  

  

Job Description: Quality Assurance Engineer (IT Specialist, Road IT )

  

  

Industry  

* Information Technology: Logistics & Supply Chain


Employment Type  

* Full-time

  

Are you ready to develop your career in a rapidly growing and successful global company acting in a fast-paced role? If you are someone looking for a position that challenges and inspire you in a successful international company, DSV is your place.  

  

The DSV group, headquartered in Denmark, is one of the biggest transports and logistics companies in the world, with more than 75,000 dedicated employees, operating in more than 90 countries.  

You will join a global and determined group driven forward by the desire to grow and will be part of a dynamic group, which is characterized by high level professionalization and constant improvement.  

  

Who do we look for?


We are in search of a highly skilled Quality Assurance Engineer who will play a crucial role in shaping the future of DSV's Quality Assurance. This role involves ensuring that our QA processes are robust, secure, and scalable enough to manage the complexities of an ever-evolving global environment. Our goal is to consistently deploy flawless solutions. To excel in this position, you must possess strong problem-solving abilities, excel in critical analysis, and demonstrate a talent for devising optimal solutions to intricate challenges.


Roles & Responsibilities:  

As a member of the Quality Assurance team in Road IT, your role will be pivotal in crafting and executing effective test protocols to ensure flawless releases of our TMS system. Additionally, you will be instrumental in the creation and deployment of automated systems and procedures, aiming to improve efficiency and reliability across our organization


* Identify automation opportunities and assess feasibility for various business processes and systems .
* Actively take part in requirement gathering of the complex requests that come in our QA pipeline.
* Create and maintain automation scripts, frameworks and tools using programming languages and automation frameworks such as Selenium, Rest Assured etc.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including developers, quality assurance professionals and project managers to gather functional and non-functional requirements and ensure all of them have passed through the required quality gates before release.
* Integrate the Automation scripts into the CI/CD pipelines schedule them accordingly.
* Setup automated Test Data Management framework
* Conduct knowledge sharing sessions within the team.

  

  

Required Experience:


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field (or equivalent experience)
* Strong Programming and scripting skills with proficiency in languages such as Java , Python or similar.
* Proven experience with developing and maintaining automation frameworks and scripts using tools like Selenium, Appium , Robot Framework , Rest Assured, TestNG etc.
* Familiarity with Software Development Cycle (SDLC) processes and methodologies such as Agile or Devops
* Excellent proven track record in requirement gathering, analysing complex functional requirements, and providing optimal QA solution.
* Experience with continuous Integration and deployment tools like Jenkins, Git or similar.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in cross teams and provide technical support.


Furthermore, we would appreciate it if you possess the following qualifications  

* Experience of working in supply chain management domain.
* Familiarity with Service Virtualization .

Behaviour Skill:


* Ability to easily communicate on and switch between levels of abstraction depending on the target group and or product stage.
* Ability to proactively establish and maintain effective working relationships.
* Ability to be a strong team player, as well as the ability to effectively influence technical teams.
* Ability to act accordingly under strong pressure, along with the ability to effectively manage crisis situations.
* Ability to evaluate information, identify key issues and formulate conclusions based on sound, practical judgment, experience, and common sense.
* Ability to deliver to and successfully manage stakeholder expectations while working in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, budgets, and resources.
* Excellent organizational, interpersonal, time management and communication skills

  

  

Location: New Delhi / Hyderabad(India)  

  

We offer you:


The opportunity to expand your experience in a truly international, world-class company whose philosophy is that your everyday work should be both varied and full of professional challenges, with wide opportunities for constant professional and personal development.  



Additionally, we offer the following:


* Medical Insurance including family and Parents up to 10 Lakh INR per year.
* 2.5 days earned leave per month which is 30 days in a calendar year & 10 days Sick Leave in a year.
* Free parking for 4-wheeler or 2-wheeler vehicle.
* Personal Mobile and Internet expenses reimbursed per calendar month subject to maximum cap.


  

Want to know more and apply?  

Please apply on the Job Posting.  



**DSV – Global Transport and Logistics**


DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.


We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.


Visit dsv.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

title: Process Manager
description:
Customer Operations - Associate Process Manager
  

India- Pune | Full-time (FT) | Customer Operations | Job ID\\_
  

  

Shift Timings – Flexible 24x7
 

Specialisation – International BPO, Voice Process
eClerx is looking to hire an experienced professional with 4-9 years of experience. As part of the Voice process team, your role will specifically focus on troubleshooting related processes. The ideal candidate will serve customers by planning and implementing strategies and operations; improving systems and processes; managing the team.


The candidate must possess in-depth functional knowledge of the process area and apply it to operational scenarios to provide effective solutions. He/she must be able to identify discrepancies and propose optimal solutions by using a logical, systematic, and sequential methodology. It is vital to be open-minded towards inputs and views from team members and to effectively lead, control, and motivate groups towards company objects. Additionally, he/she must be self-directed, proactive and seize every opportunity to meet internal and external customer needs and achieve customer satisfaction by effectively auditing processes, implementing best practices and process improvements, and utilizing the frameworks and tools available. Goals and thoughts must be clearly and concisely articulated and conveyed, verbally and in writing, to clients, colleagues, subordinates, and supervisors.


He/she must also possess an understanding of the repair process in Telecom and Cable industry, with an ability to analyse information and evaluate results to choose best solutions and solve problems.


**Customer Operations Associate Process Manager Responsibilities**

* Prepares performance reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing data and trends
* Ensure Critical Performance Metrics are met consistently
* Lead client/vendor reviews/calibrations
* Revert to client/vendor queries on routine issues
* Provide innovative ideas to optimize internal metrics & ensure critical matrices are met timely
* Manage multiple teams
* Perform audits and quality checks on Team Leads & Floor Supports
* Provide feedback to the Team Leads & Floor Supports periodically on their performance
* Ensure cross skilling and periodic process re-verification to ensure resource pool
* Perform Training Need Identification for teams
* Perform Bottom Quartile Management
* Ensure directives from senior leadership are percolated and acted upon
* Hold periodic meetings, discuss task delegation and review issues
* Conduct team huddles and meetings to discuss operational updates
* Build team spirit through group sessions, activities, and projects
* Focus on retention of staff through career mapping & guiding team members
* Advocate and follow organizational policies and procedures
* Adhere to the information security requirements
* Ensure all client deliverables met within timelines
* Ensure productivity/quality enhancement and process meet all metrics
* Remediation of any major incident
* Manage client MBR/QBR deck, client calls and reviews

**Minimum Qualifications**

Overall experience of 4+ years and should be a graduate or post graduate in any specialisation


**Preferred Qualifications**

* Graduation in Computer Science, Computer Applications or related subjects

eClerx provides critical business operations services to over fifty global Fortune 500 clients, including some of the world’s leading companies across financial services, cable & telecom, retail, fashion, media & entertainment, manufacturing, travel & leisure, software, and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India’s leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 9,500-plus people across its global sites in the US, UK, India, Italy, Germany, Singapore, Thailand.


eClerx Customer Operations specializes in providing operational expertise and process excellence throughout the customer journey. We create solutions and services, utilizing a blend of technology and domain knowledge that support our clients’ evolving needs. Our suite of offerings enhances the customer experience by providing digital care support, quality monitoring & insights, advanced analytics, automation, superior technical operations support, and consulting services. We assist companies in developing, implementing, and operating multichannel customer interaction capabilities – transforming everyday touchpoints into a superior customer experience.


*eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, per applicable law.*

title: Maintenance Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Application Support Manager to join our dynamic IT team. In this role, you will be responsible for providing leadership and oversight for the application support team, ensuring the smooth operation and uptime of critical applications. You will work closely with support engineers, developers, system administrators, and end-users to troubleshoot and resolve application issues, ensuring timely resolution and a positive user experience.  


**Responsibilities:**

Lead and manage a team of 20 plus application support specialists, providing guidance, training, and performance management.

Implement the defined SLA's

Develop and implement processes and procedures for application support, ensuring efficient resolution of issues.

Analyze, diagnose, and troubleshoot application incidents and problems, escalating complex issues to developers as needed.

Implement and maintain knowledge base articles and documentation for user self-service and support team reference.

Monitor application performance metrics and proactively identify potential issues to prevent downtime and ensure optimal system health.

Work collaboratively with developers and system administrators to identify the root cause of issues and implement solutions.

Track and report on application support activities and performance metrics.

Stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends related to application support and troubleshooting.  


**Qualifications:**

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology

Minimum 12+ years of experience in application support and maintenance

Proven experience in leading and managing a team

Well versed with ITSM framework

Prefer to have profile with .Net framework and cloud experience

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal

Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment

Experience with ticketing systems like ServiceNow and knowledge base tools

Good to have experience on monitoring tools

Should be flexible to work in shifts / UK shift timing  

**Primary Location****:** India-Karnataka-Bangalore**Job Posting****:** Mar 6, 2024**Experience Required (In Years)****:** **Minimum****-** 12 **Maximum****-** 17

title: Software Analyst
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **Job Title: Software Asset Management Analyst – Supervising Associate**


At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **The opportunity**


We are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced Software Asset Management Analyst to join our team. The candidate will be responsible for managing, controlling, and protecting the software assets managed by Enterprise Technology. You will assess the software requirements, manage the software inventory, and ensure compliance with software licensing agreements.

 **Your key responsibilities**

* Stakeholder engagement and licensing use case analysis
* Determine licensing service requirements
* Provide advice, lead projects and run managed services related to software licensing optimisation
* Carry out software asset management processes, including detailed analytics of contracts, usage and deployment data, forecasts and budgets
* Maintain reports on targeted software assets, including purchases, license details, and usage.
* Verify compliance with software licenses, contracts, and vendor agreements to prevent legal liability and financial losses.
* Use software asset management tools to monitor software usage and license allocation.
* Develop and implement software license optimization strategies to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
* Collaborate with product managers and other stakeholders across the organization to understand software needs and ensure they are adequately met.
* Lead external vendor audit defence engagement (SCS in support), in sometimes hostile situations, devising strategy, conveying information clearly, liasing with GCO, working with user reps and budget holders
* Identify and resolve any discrepancies or anomalies in software asset records.
* Assist in the negotiation of software contracts with vendors and manage ongoing vendor relationships.
* Keep up to date with industry developments, software licensing models, and regulatory changes in order to proactively manage risks.

 **Skills and attributes for success**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical information into understandable terms.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Strong negotiation skills, with a background in vendor relationship management.
* Experience of working in $100m+ contract renewal projects, in collaboration with supply chain services and as part of a commercial strategy
* Experience working with hands-on teams to extract usage data from vendor license consoles/portals, interpret and define compliance reports
* Strong stakeholder and supplier management skills
* Proven experience of Software Contract Analysis and Reporting methodology
* Proven experience of leading cross-functional teams, conflict resolution and supplier performance management
* Knowledge and proven experience of managing legacy perpetual license agreements alongside new subscription-based models (e.g. Software as a Service)
* Proven track record of leading resolution of software license compliance issues, minimising financial impacts
* Familiarity with Data Analytics products and licensing environments, including Tableau, TIBCO, Alteryx, PowerBI
* Billing validation experience
* Experience in the creation of chargeback reports in collaboration with finance teams
* Experience supporting often large complex renewals with trend analysis and optimization opportunity reports
* Experience working with large complex supplier licensing models & compliance approaches is a plus; e.g. Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, HP, etc.

 **To qualify for the role you must have**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
* Proven experience in software asset management, IT asset management, or a similar role.
* Detailed understanding of software licensing models and compliance requirements.
* Experience using software asset management tools and systems

 **What we look for**

* If you are a dedicated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for software management and compliance, we would love to add you to our team. Apply today and grow your career with us.

 **What we offer**


As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:

* Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  



EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  



Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Accounts Receivable Clerk
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **JD Description:**


The Accounts Receivable Senior Associate is a member of a high performing and mixed rank team led by the UKI Country Accounting Manager.


This role sits within the UKI Controlling team which helps the business create success by managing risk, mitigating fraud, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and Firm policy, driving quality, consistency and efficiency across the accounting processes.

 **The opportunity**


We are looking for an analytical accounts receivable professional to assist our accounting department as it receives, processes, and collects payment on outstanding invoices. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and resolving payments that have been allocated as Cash on Account and or Unidentified payments. You will need to review client account information, correct discrepancies, and ensure that all payments are accurately allocated to the correct invoices.

 **Key responsibilities**

* Researching and resolving payments that have been allocated as Cash on Account and or Unidentified.
* Maintaining records regarding payments and account statuses.
* Obtaining information from other departments to ensure records are accurate and complete and that accounts receivable ledgers and journals are up-to-date.
* Working with the collections department to review accounts, client payments,
* Generating reports and statements for internal use.
* Engaging in ongoing educational opportunities to update job knowledge.
* Work as a point of contact for the receivable cash allocation.
* Liaise with internal and external parties for escalation and problem resolution
* Support with problem solving and fact-finding analysis
* Support financial close activities, as needed
* Looking at system and process improvement
* Providing ad-hoc reporting
* Work in other functional areas to cover absences or relief, peak work period’s, or to balance the workload

 **Skills and attributes for success**

* Skilled and thorough researcher
* Can work with minimal supervision
* Develops a good network and connects to stakeholders to grow knowledge and build good relationships.
* Builds a knowledge of UK entities / Service Line and Sub Service line functions.
* Inspiring trust and have a firm understanding of business drivers of client performance
* Critical thinking and problem solving, advising on potential outcomes and exhibiting exceptional technical skills
* Confident, with a proven ability to challenge at all levels
* Strong analytical and numeracy skills, with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
* Excellent written, oral and virtual communication skills with the confidence to deliver presentations, training material and knowledge sharing. Adapting ability to deliver challenging messages and drive communication to a mutual understanding.

 **To qualify for the role, you must have:**

* Minimum two years’ Experience in a similar role in a fast-paced environment
* Strong math, typing, and computer skills, especially with bookkeeping software.
* Excellent communication, research, problem-solving, and time management skills.
* High level of accuracy, efficiency, and accountability.
* Attention to detail
* Ability to build relationships with clients and internal departments
* Knowledge of SAP would be an advantage

 **What we look for**


You will be an experienced Trusted Business Advisor with a passion for providing exceptional client service to your stakeholders whilst maintaining high levels of customer service for internal stakeholders.

 **What working at EY offers**  

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:

* Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
* Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
* The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Information Technology Manager
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION  

  

About KPMG in India**

***KPMG entities in India are professional services firm(s). These Indian member firms are affiliated with KPMG International Limited. KPMG was established in India in August 1993. Our professionals leverage the global network of firms, and are conversant with local laws, regulations, markets and competition. KPMG has offices across India in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chandigarh, Chennai, Gurugram, Jaipur, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Kochi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Noida, Pune, Vadodara and Vijayawada.***

***KPMG entities in India offer services to national and international clients in India across sectors. We strive to provide rapid, performance-based, industry-focused and technology-enabled services, which reflect a shared knowledge of global and local industries and our experience of the Indian business environment.***

title: Application Specialist
description:
**JOB SUMMARY** (Brief narrative that highlights the primary duties of the job)  



Vertiv is focusing on overhauling the technology landscape of the Service business by rewriting the application ecosystem needed for our Customer Engineer activities for pre-visit, during the visit, and post-visit activities on the field.  



This role is part of the Operations team that will manage the Monitoring, Incident, Change, QA, Release, Performance of the entire application ecosystem with specific expertise on the Google ApiGee and Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) integration layers  



Context and activities are international and global in scope, with the need to engage with diverse global functions and cultures.  



**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:** (List the major or most important job duties in order of most important to least important.)  



The main job duties:


* Manage the applications integrations
* Monitor the application ecosystem
* Troubleshoot incident
* Ensuring reliability, security, and performance of the app
* Perform routine maintenance tasks and upgrades
* Perform QA for new applications release
* Perform release process (create new application build, …)
Update application documentation  
* 

**ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

On Call outside working hours  



**REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS** **:** (Titles of associates directly supervised.)


None  



**INTERACTIONS** **:** (Describe the relationships and degree of contact with internal and external individuals or groups)


* Managers or technical persons in the IT Department
* Managers or functional persons in the Service line of business
3rd Party Vendors  
* 

**POSITION ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS** **:** (Special conditions required of the job such as travel, driver’s license, physical working conditions.)


Occasional international travel may be required – up to 1 per year.  

* 

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:** (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required.)


* Fluency in English (oral and written)
* Excellent knowledge of Oracle Integration Cloud
* Excellent knowledge of Google ApiGee
* Excellent knowledge of IT infrastructures
* Good troubleshooting skills
* Good knowledge of Jira
* Good knowledge of ITSM processes
Knowledge of IT enterprise architecture and applications landscape  
* 

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:** (The minimum education, certification, special training and years of experience required to do a satisfactory job.)


* Preferred Master/Bachelor’s degree with preference for Information Systems or Computer Science as field of study
* 4+ years of experience in the Application Operations having worked with complex 2nd level and 3rd level support
